com.sun.jna
Class Structure

java.lang.Object
  com.sun.jna.Structure
Direct Known Subclasses:
GDI32.BITMAPINFO, GDI32.BITMAPINFOHEADER, GDI32.RECT, GDI32.RGBQUAD, GDI32.RGNDATA, GDI32.RGNDATAHEADER, Kernel32.FILE_NOTIFY_INFORMATION, Kernel32.OVERLAPPED, Kernel32.SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES, Kernel32.SYSTEMTIME, Shell32.SHFILEOPSTRUCT, User32.BLENDFUNCTION, User32.FLASHWINFO, User32.GUITHREADINFO, User32.POINT, User32.SIZE, User32.WINDOWINFO, X11.Xrender.XRenderDirectFormat, X11.Xrender.XRenderPictFormat, X11.XSetWindowAttributes, X11.XSizeHints, X11.XTextProperty, X11.XVisualInfo, X11.XWindowAttributes, X11.XWMHints
public abstract class Structure
extends Object

Represents a native structure with a Java peer class.

See the overview for supported type mappings.

Note: this class and its methods are not threadsafe! You must ensure that this class is used in a safe manner.

Note: Strings are used to represent native C strings because usage of char * is generally more common than wchar_t *.

Author:
Todd Fast, todd.fast@sun.com, twall@users.sf.net

Method Detail

setTypeMapper

protected void setTypeMapper(TypeMapper mapper)
Change the type mapping for this structure. May cause the structure to be resized and any existing memory to be reallocated. If null, the default mapper for the defining class will be used.

setAlignment

protected void setAlignment(int alignment)
Change the alignment of this structure. Re-allocates memory if necessary. If alignment is ALIGN_DEFAULT, the default alignment for the defining class will be used.

allocateMemory

protected void allocateMemory()

useMemory

protected void useMemory(Pointer m)
Set the memory used by this structure. This method is used to indicate the given structure is nested within another or otherwise overlaid on some other memory block and thus does not own its own memory.

useMemory

protected void useMemory(Pointer m,
                         int offset)
Set the memory used by this structure. This method is used to indicate the given structure is nested within another or otherwise overlaid on some other memory block and thus does not own its own memory.

toString

public String toString()

toArray

public Structure[] toArray(Structure[] array)
Returns a view of this structure's memory as an array of structures. Note that this Structure must have a public, no-arg constructor. If the structure is currently using a Memory backing, the memory will be resized to fit the entire array.

toArray

public Structure[] toArray(int size)
Returns a view of this structure's memory as an array of structures. Note that this Structure must have a public, no-arg constructor. If the structure is currently using a Memory backing, the memory will be resized to fit the entire array.
